Unfortunately, I couldn't finish it knowing I had a full pasta dish coming - this would be a good one to share.  The Squid Ink Linguini was awesome!  There was the perfect amount of lobster and sauce to go with the pasta.

All in all I would definitely go back to try some other items, including the pizza which looked delicious.

I made a reservation for 2 for my birthday a few months in advance. I was a little nervous with all the mixed reviews, but off we went.

We were seated promptly at our reservation time, but at a 4 top that only had 3 chairs. It was a bit odd, as I sat on one side, facing my husband and an empty chair. Oh well. The decor was nice and it was a good crowd for a rainy Wednesday night.

I ordered a glass of Prosecco, which was brought our promptly. Our server made several suggestions regarding the menu. We ended up not following any of them. We ordered the daily focaccia (mushroom), braised short rib ravioli and the gnocchi.

The focaccia was nothing special. It came with olive oil and parm cheese for dipping. I am glad that we ordered it though, because our pastas took FOREVER to come out.

Both the ravioli and gnocchi were delicious. Portions were small, as expected, but we knew we wanted to order dessert, so that was fine. I recommend both dishes.

As for service, after we placed our order, we didn't see our server again until we were finished. It would have been nice for him to see if I wanted another drink, or to update us on how long our food was taking. We didn't have too much of an issue with the water refiller, as it was just two of us, so no reaching over to refill, but I did see it being an issue with a larger group seated near us.

Dessert was the donuts that come with squeeze containers of sauce to inject. It was fun, but I ended up covered in sugar. They also gave me birthday cake gelato, which was yummy as well.

In the end, we were there for over 2 hours, which seemed excessive for bread, pasta and donuts. Perhaps thats why a reservation is so hard to get?

For lunch, I think you could do better for a business meet-up. However, if you're in River North, you'll do just fine here.

The pastas are good for lunch. If you're going with a burger, you could probably dance around elsewhere in the dozen or so meat-oriented restaurants within a four-block radius. I'll give this a straight-up 2.5 star rating. The three stars is rounding up.

Good...Not bad...Not bad...Good.

BD

Ambience is so nice! Music was on point an the food was delightful. The spicy pepperoni pizza was delish. Also the roasted peppers were awesome. Bruschetta was also great. Service was cordial and fast. Great place to hang out with a group of friends!

As much as I enjoy going to scene-y restaurants, typically I am a harsh reviewer if the food sucks. Such was not the case with Siena!
Truth is, in cities like NYC; if it is a hotspot then the food is equally as epic as the hype surrounding it. Chicago is absolutely not this way.
Jellyfish for example, the sole reason they're alive is because of the location and goofballs who want to look cool.
Siena was a wonderful breath of fresh air!
Grilled Octopus, incredible and cooked to perfection. Not easy! I am incredibly picky with my Octopus.
Burrata-awesome.
And the best for last...Truffle Mushroom Pizza was absolutely divine.
My friends loved the Heirloom carrot, I was not the biggest fan.
For 4 light-eating ladies, this was the absolute perfect amount!
Dessert, the restaurant graciously comp'd us the Tiramisu and Bombolini.
Tiramisu was too much cream and not enough cake. Bombolini came complete with three delicious sauce "squirters." Order it! So good.
Will absolutely be back ASAP!

Wow. I read previous reviews before we went to Siena Tavern and knew I was going to get a great meal... but this place far exceeded my expectations.

Six of us came here on a Saturday night before seeing a show. Even during our 5:30 reservation, the place was busy. First good sign. My sister-in-law and her boyfriend were running late, but my husband and I, along with my in-laws, got seated right away. We ordered drinks and our server offered up some suggestions for appetizers. Both my husband and I had the Siena Draft, a beer brewed specifically for Siena. We are both beer snobs, and thought this one was good. Not incredible, but good.

For an appetizer, we had the Grilled Octopus, which was delicious. We also ordered a couple cheeses -- the gorgonzola and the pecorino. Both were amazing, but the cheese portions are insanely small. There was actually only enough for one small piece of each cheese for each of us -- and for $7/cheese, I wasn't too pleased with that.

And then the best part... the actual meal! I was lucky enough to try most everything that everyone ordered, so here's my two cents:

- Pizza Bar: I ordered the Carne pizza (sausage, bacon, salami and more) and it was awesome. I would absolutely, 100% get this pizza again. My FIL ordered the Wild Boar pizza (butternut squash and a bunch of other things I don't really know) and it had the most unique taste for a pizza I've ever had. It had a sweetness to it. It was great, but I probably would never order it.

- Pasta: My husband ordered the Orecchiette, which had sausage, spices and pecorino cheese... and it was so good -- highly recommend. My MIL ordered the Pasta in a Jar. Normally, I would not try this because it has mushrooms in it, but everyone was saying what a unique taste it had, so I had to take a small bite. It was also very delicious. My SIL ordered the Gnocci, and it was by far the best dish I tasted that night. When I go back to Siena, I will definitely get this pasta.

- Meat: My SIL's boyfriend got the lamb, which I didn't try, but he said it was really great. The meat fell off the bones -- always a good sign!

I went for lunch with my team yesterday, and I'd have to say that our overall experience was fantastic. We shared the squid ink linguine, gnocchi, burrata, and prosciutto and pear pizza, and we enjoyed everything, particularly the first three items. The pizza was good, but I wouldn't consider Siena to be a "pizza" destination.

The burrata was so incredibly smooth, albeit a bit on the slightly-too-sweet side, but definitely a strong start to the meal. My favorite was the squid ink linguine with grilled lobster. Flavorful, creamy, delicately cooked lobster. The gnocchi was melt-in-your-mouth soft, and the sauce didn't have an over-abundance of truffle oil infused cream. I didn't find the prosciutto and pear pizza to be fantastic, nor was it in any way offensive. I'll reserve further judgment until I'm able to try more of the pizzas at a later date.

Service was a bit slow, but they ended up making up for it by comp'ing us the pizza. This was unexpected, but highly appreciated. This level of service bumped the review from a 4* to a 5*.

The place is definitely a scene, but that's to be expected from a Top Chef restaurant in River North, I suppose. I'll definitely be back, if I can find room...
Great patio, amazing food and service. It's the perfect location downtown for business meals, but also turns into a cozy date spot in the evening. I recommend the pear prosciutto flatbread!

After making reservations a month and a half ago, I couldn't wait to have dinner here for a girls night out. It was super busy when we walked in and Fabio was at the hostess stand. Exciting way to start the night. For 5 girls we ordered...

Siena Chopped Salad: Very clean tasting. Cannelini beans, pepperoncini, and especially the boar salami were delish. I didnt really get the mustard dressing taste or any avocado now that I think about it, bummer.

Smoked Mozz: Good earthy smokey flavor and texture, tasted like it was made in house. Had to ask for more bread since it only comes with 3 pieces.

Gnocchi: This was SO rich and the favorite of the night. Yes we split this one gnocchi dish between 5 girls! But honestly, between the bacon, cream, and cheese I am not sure how someone could eat more than a little serving. Great melt in your mouth texture.

Burnt Pep pizza: The pepperonis were delicious (I wonder if they come from a local butcher here?) cut super super thin which crisped up nicely in the oven and had the perfect heat between the chilis and red pepper flakes. Would get this again in a heartbeat. Outer crust was nice and fluffy but the underneath crust could have held up a little more.

Pear and Prosciutto pizza: Great balance between sweet and savory. Thinly cut pear slices (they didn't taste grilled though...tasted more like they were red wine poached?) didn't overpower but added a great dimension.

A few of us ordered gelato...the standout was the tiramisu flavor. I wish we got the whole tiramisu dessert instead. The other gelatos (hazelnut and olive oil/lemon) were not that great. They came out half melted...not cool!

Overall we can't wait to go back to hit up the bar area which was bumping.

Oh Siena Tavern, you are fabulous and what I've been looking for. When I walked in I immediately noticed the plush decor and the beautiful bar area. We decided to order the brussel sprout salad, the grilled octopus for our starters. The octopus was super tender and delicious and the salad was crisp and refreshing. For our entrees we had the mushroom pizza and squid ink pasta. Both dishes were delicious! I can't wait to go back!

My very first review, excited to say it's 5 stars. I'm not hugely into Italian cuisine, but this place is phenomenal from the crudo to the flatbreads. Don't miss the octopus or the meatball and be sure to share the squid ink pasta and short rib ravioli!
Could not get service at a bar table after 20 minutes waiting will not come back. It was busy but the staff did not seem sensitive to customers.

Surprisingly friendly and good food!

I was hesitant to venture to Siena Tavern until this place cooled off a bit, but husBAND was insistent.  We popped in a couple of weeks ago at about 8:00 pm to get some drinks and check the place out.  We only waited about 7 minutes before we were able to score some seats at the overly crowded bar.  The bartender was super friendly and the other patrons weren't snots at all...this little discovery perplexed me as I had imagined a totally different scene.  We had a few drinks and the warm chocolate butter cake (OMG good!) and then moved on, but promising to return after seeing all of the food come out while seated at the bar.

The following week we decided to hit Siena Tavern first and have dinner.  We got there early...like 6:00 pm and scored some bar seats immediately.  We drank for a couple of hours and then proceeded to order and eat.  We ordered the Bufala Mozzarella to start which comes with bread.  Very good and tasty!  My husBAND ordered the Farro pasta and had a grilled chicken breast added.  He loved it.  I ordered the gnocchi...so freaking good.  I practically licked my plate clean.  We had anticipated letting our food settle and then try a different dessert to split, but our friend arrived and we got to talking and drinking.  By the time we realized it was already 11:30 pm.  So, we paid up and kept the party moving.

Overall, very good food, decently priced, friendly service, and very low on the D-bag scale.  We will definitely be back!

My husband and I have been here dozens of times. We've always had a great experience! Every food and beverage we've ordered have been amazing. I highly recommend trying the red sangria, it's much better than the white in my opinion. Lunch and dinner are great, but so is brunch. If I was still single, I'd hit up the bar area on a weekend evening. It's definitely a good place to meet people, eat good food and enjoy the ambiance and atmosphere of a chic Italian restaurant. Also, make sure you try the monkey bread. It is absolutely scrumptious!

This place was ok. Super trendy and the hostess had kind of an attitude. She asked for my phone number but didn't say why and then we went to the bar to get drinks, which is right next to the hostess stand. After a while she never came to get us and I walked two feet over and she said she texted me twice that our table was ready. That would have worked if she told us why she was asking for my number and that she would text us when our table was ready. Ugh. Also the credit card machine was so slow at the bar, and I had to wait a while for our bill. The bartender was super nice and ended up coming over to our table with it about 20 minutes later. We started with the smoked mozz cheese with grilled escarole.  The cheese was delish but the escarole was perhaps left on the grill a little too long. It was beyond charred and tasted like ashes, inedible.    However, the pastas that we ordered were  excellent.  We got the carrot angolini(?) and the gnocchi.  Both were really good! I would look up the details on the menu right now to post more info, their website is currently down. Looks like  this place has some tech issues, but overall the food was good, minus the escarole.

pics.caption: Carrot stuffed pillows with a sage brown butter sauce, so delish!
Escarole was really burnt on the smoked mozzarella dish. It was like eating ashes...

review.des:
Soooo good! I have been talking about this place to whoever will listen since I went about a month ago.

The Tuscan Kale Caesar was so good I'm still thinking about it!  I'm not a huge sushi person but my girlfiends had me try the Hamachi and I love it!  We also ordered the squid ink linguini and it was insane!

Finally finished off with the Bomboloni.... SO SO GOOD!

GO!

PS It was FILLED with "broski's" at the bar- be forewarned!

I had such high hopes for this place but sadly it just isn't all that. There are so many amazing restaurants around Chicago without it being attached to a famous chief. This restaurant is best summed up as not bad not great... Meh. I struggled giving it 3 or 4 stars.  I went with 4 just to give this place the benefit of the doubt and i liked the atmosphere. We take groups of clients out when visiting Chicago and unfortunately everyone left pretty disappointed.  Oh well.

My experience at Sienna Tavern this weekend was great! We had a reservation for 10:00 p.m. and were seated very promptly. We were given a table right next to the door. It was super windy and every time someone came in and out, we got blown away (literally).  When we asked to be moved, the waitress moved us to a great corner table without hesitation.

The best part of the entire experience was of course...the FOOD! We started with the buratta. It was a little small, but boy was it good! The bread they serve with it is toasted perfectly with butter and a hint of salt. Perfection!

For dinner I shared the truffle gnocchi and the spicy watermelon salad with my dining companion. I swear, the spicy watermelon salad is truly the unsung hero of the menu. It is truly sensational. The watermelon is super fresh and it has this incredible peach/soy dressing.

Finally we ended with the famous bombolone (donuts). They were served with four decadent sauces including; hazelnut, white chocolate, salted carmel and raspberry.

I couldn't recommend this place more! One draw back was the service was a tad slow, but totally worth it for the amazing food!

I will be coming back :)

We wanted to like this place more than we did and had very high expectations - Fabio/Top Chef, etc.  *PROSCIUTTO PEAR pizza = C (too sweet), Kale Salad - could have been great but way overdressed - C+, Meatball - B- (it's a nothing-special meatball), Roasted Cauliflower = A.  No. 8 Cocktail = A, Bartenders = A - (she was great at mixing cocktails but didn't know the menu).  Overall vibe = B-.  I'm missing the link to Siena and some metal contraption at the front of the restaurant and the back bar.

If we go back, it must be for the gnocchi based on other reviewers.

We really did want to like it and tried over and over but mostly fell flat.

Let me start off by saying.. Worth every penny. My friends and I went to have brunch at Siena on New Years Day. The french toast were to die for. We ate the french toast as an appetizer. As a meal, I had the steak and eggs. The steak was perfectly cooked.

Our waiter was amazing and super attentive. He constantly came over to our table to ask if we were okay and if we needed anything else.

I will definitely go back for dinner.
Great Service and Great Food! Awesome out door seating! Highly recommend this place for lunch (or dinner, but we have only gone for lunch!)

A new gem in Chicago. We weren't able to get a reservation...it was booked. But we decided to stick around and were able to get a bar seat. So glad we did.
We ordered the grilled octopus and waygu beef tartar. The octopus was grilled perfectly; one if the beat we've had. The tartar, unfortunately, was below average. It wasn't spiced up enough and wasn't tender. But we ate it so it didn't suck!
We had the Pasta in a Jar and holy deal was that good! Much better than advertised. I had a hard time blocking my husband's fork from my plate. We also had the Orecchiette which was very good. The chunks of sausage were so good and cooked perfectly.
D'Angelo was our bartender and he paired wines with our meal. He definitely knows what he's doing.
We will be back next time we are in Chicago.
If you go, ask for D'Angelo... he'll treat you right and you won't be disappointed.

I came here this passed weekend. The place itself is pretty spacious and modern, very pretty.  The waitress and hosts were very nice as well. I was not crazy about their food though. I had a burnt pepperoni pizza which i did like and I also got the short rib ravioli which i was not happy with at all! Not only did I pay $20+ for it, it was gross and the serving size was way too small for the price you pay. Unfortunately, I will probably not be back.

Stopped here on NYE for a late lunch with a small group of friends. I tried the house craft brew, and was pleased with the product. Light, mildly hoppy and a hint of fruit. It went down very easily. As for the food, we sampled a number of items, and I was lucky enough to sample quite a few of them. I sampled the the gnocchi, stuffed raviolo, meatballs, one of the salads and the carne pizza. I was a fan of all of them, but can honestly say the pizza was nothing special in my opinion. Very fresh, and tasty, but nothing that made it stand out from the other various pizza places in chicago.

The only reason I am giving four stars is because of the service. Understood that the staffing might be low on NYE (especially at the 1:30-3pm hour) but we found ourselves wondering where our waitress had run off to multiple times.

This is my new favorite restaurant in Chicago.  From the minute you walk in, you can tell this place is top notch and has paid attention to details.  It's a big space but never feels too big or empty.  The decor is perfect.  Little touches like the fresh herb garden growing in drawers behind the crudo bar are nice touches.  

The food is phenomenal. Everything I have guests in town, I take them here and they are amazed.   The Coccoli is a really amazing.  This could become the signature dish for Siena.  It's unique and delicious.  We loved everything that we had, but the Squid Ink pasta was another highlight for me.  

This place has phenomenal food but is also a great place to stop for a drink.  Great cocktail and wine list.

One of my go to spots to eat downtown! Always busy on a weekend night and have to wait for a table but, the bar is a fun place to have a few drinks before you are seated and the food is worth the wait! Any pasta dish is amazing!  Can't go wrong here!

Dinned here twice on our trip to Chicago.  Service was extremely attentive from the server to the bus boys and expediters.  All of our courses exceeded our expectations in taste, presentation, and execution.

I stopped in on arriving for a business trip. I'd just gotten off a train that was delayed for two hours and felt fairly wilted from the travel and walking in the heat with all my luggage.

The place is cool and dimly lit and I was promptly greeted with an offer for luggage check. I freshened up in the restroom which was immaculately clean and then bar perched, since I was traveling solo.

The bartender was super friendly and prompt and put a glass of white wine in front of me pronto. He did upsell as he suggested the $12 glass over the $10, but it was delicious. The menu was varied and everything looked good given how hungry I was. He helped steer me in a good direction with pizza that was perfectly prepared, immensely flavorful, and not too thin but not fat on the crust. I got a half and half...margarita on one half and a mushroom blend on the other.

It was a good-sized pie and at $18, not a bargain but beyond satisfying. Before heading out, I decided to try one of the cocktails the bartenders were frequently shaking up from a variety of house-made elixirs. I tried one that had a Lavendar syrup and other intriguing ingredients.

I was pleasantly surprised when the cocktail was left off my bill. I was invited back and my only regret is that my agenda didn't permit a return visit.

This place is lovely, friendly, well-appointed, and has a great menu.

I was excited to try this place due to the high reviews. I am from Los Angeles and when a restaurAnt is rated four stars and up it's because it the best. We are foodies and always on the look out for that restaurant that stands out. However, this place was disappointing to me perhaps I have been spoiled in LA with amazing restaurants. The food at Sienna Tavern was ok, but not great. It was very average and nothing special. My marinara sauce was too salty that after a few bites I had to stop eating. The Gelatos were not very good either. For the price, there has to be better restaurants out there and I intend to find them. P.s. The meatball was delicious, so if I go back that's the only thing I would get.

Highly highly recommend!! We had very high expectations and were somehow still impressed!

The atmosphere is second to none, just perfect!! Spread out seating, perfect noise level. We had reservations at 645, so it seemed like the earlier crowd still there was very casual - however as it got later the attire became very trendy/going out feel. Perfect to bring parents to earlier and friends later!!

Food was phenomenal!!! The Gnocchi is a MUST!! We ended up ordering too much food, but no one was too upset about bringing home the leftovers :)

Drinks were fun and pretty good as well!

Great, friendly service!

The food is mediocre and the staff is terrible.  We came in on a Saturday night (a group of 5), accidentally sat at a "wrong" table and the security immediately came with their stupid muscles and acted like they were going to beat the crap out of us 5 girls.  We moved from the table with no issues when they asked us.  We then waited for a table, got seated and 1 of us got denied service because she said "woohoo"!
Really?  We were then asked to leave because 1 of us were apparently intoxicated ,ridiculous!  I will never come here again and never recommend it to anyone.  With so many better restaurants in Chicago,  this was my mistake. Sorry, I am a born and raised in Chicago, i know how the industry goes.  I have been to Everest,
Charlie Trotters in Lincoln Park, and all of Rick Bayless, they would never treat a customer like a piece of shit.  Thanks Sienna Tavern, and Fabio, I'm also going on Facebook, Trip advisor, and any other sites i can think of.

I loved everything about this place except for maybe how crowded it is at the bar area, and the noise level.  Its pretty loud in there!
But the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful which is amazing given the huge amounts of people that are in there.  The atmosphere is pretty cool.  It doesn't feel all nightclubby like it does in RPM.  
Everything is reasonably priced.  I was here with a big group and we had bottles of wine so we really racked up the bill.  But its a great way to have a little bit of everything.  We started w/ the meatball and octopus.  The sauce the meatball was in was fantastic.  The octopus was cooked perfectly.  Maybe the only gripe is that there were 7 of us and they set down a plate of 6 slices of bread.  
Then they ordered the burnt pepperoni pizza.  I didn't have any but they said the crust was great.  We also had a side of cauliflower which could be a main dish!  It had a lot going on in a good way.  Perfectly seasoned.  I shared the risotto which had corn and fava beans and the spaghetti with crab.  OMG the crab!  They do not skimp on the meat.  That was my favorite although the risotto was springy, light and perfectly cooked.  My friend next to me had the duck which I don't eat but I tried a noodle b/c everyone was raving about the sauce.  And yes that was the best sauce of the night.  It was the right amount of anise.  The friend across from me got the brick chicken which we all poo-pooed at first but that was the star of the show.  Crispy, lemon, juicy chicken with potatoes.  Yum!!  For dessert you cannot pass up the doughnuts.  I want to steal that little bottle of caramel sauce but instead I just ate it all right there!  The doughnut is light and sweet and outstanding.  You really only need one.  We also tried the chocolate butter cake which was good but paled in comparison to the doughnuts.  And the cannoli which was very good too!
I will definitely be back many many more times.

Nothing short of delicious! Everything I ate was great.  We went with a large group and were able I taste a ton.

The watermelon salad was smaller than I thought, but it was fresh, spicy and creamy at the same time. The gnocchi was the best gnocchi I've ever eaten. Almost buttery rich but still air fluffy .. The texture is a cross between pasta, a marshmallow and Cotton candy. The pepperoni pizza was oven roasted and awesome.  The brick chicken was crispy on the outside and so juicy inside.

Don't forget to try their specialty drinks. #12 was great. Great balance between sweet and letting the flavor I the liquors show thru.

I thought Siena Tavern was great. My husband and I dined here for my birthday, and had wonderful service.

The specialty cocktails are a must try. I'm not a heavy drinker, but I certainly enjoy a deliciously crafted libation when available. I had a delicious version of a manhattan made with Maker's Mark that had just the right hint of allspicy-ness. My husband, who enjoys Black Label as a stand-by, had a cocktail with that as its base, but also incorporated some citrus components. Quite tasty.

The grilled octopus antipasti was excellent! I love grilled octopus and order it whenever I see it on a menu. Here, they marinate it for 24 hours and it absolutely works - very tender and just delicious!

The mozzarella bar did not disappoint. Except when my husband ate most of it and was reluctant to share ;)

I had to try the Truffle Gnocchi, and it certainly lived up to all the hype. It is, however, very rich with the truffle cream sauce and the truffle oil. A bit of a tasty splurge, if you will.

My husband sampled the orecchiette with sausage and enjoyed it very much; especially because it had some heat.

Being my birthday they brought over a tasty birthday surprise: funfetti cake and sprinkles, folded into gelato. All homemade; all delicious!

Not knowing to expect the birthday gelato, we ordered two desserts: monkeybread and chocolate cake. Both delicious; however the chocolate cake was very rich and after a fairly rich dinner, it was just too much. If you want to splurge on dessert, keep that in mind when ordering antipasti and entrée.

The cappuccino was good. They brew Lavazza which is not my favorite, but if it happens to be your favorite - there you go!

Overall, a stellar dining experience. There were several other items on the menu I would definitely return to try!

Thank the man upstairs I wore my checkered button down so I can match every other d-bag that act like they have money at this place!  Yes its poshy but the food is good!  The staff is great and very accomodating!!  Advising great recommendations. Prices are pretty standard for River North, the beers are priced fairly on the lower end.  Def add this place to your list of must go to's its worth it.  The pizza w/ the marinated eggplant and burrata is to die for!

I love the food but tonight (Thursday) had a late/9 pm reservation  for 8 people including out of town guests--and the thumping music made it impossible to talk and at 10 pm our table by the pizza oven went dark. Automatically at 10 said the manager. We had to use our phones to see our food. Then the euro disco music came on even louder. We are in our mid forties and not fussy dud dies but it was as loud as a rock concert. Ruined the dining experience. If this is now a nightclub vs restaurant then stop taking dinner reservations!

Great dining experience with friends...

Siena Tavern is a Top Chef place, guy from Bravo,  bla bla. I stopped listening and agreed to check it out.  

I am glad I did !!

The menu has an array of Italian favorites, however had some new additions I have not seen before.   The Cuccoli and Crudo Bar selections were fantastic.   We were a table of 4 and ended up sharing everything.  Our waitress Hannah was very knowledgeable and helped guide our choices the entire evening.   It is a big plus when the wait staff knows their customers and the menu.  

Next visit we are trying the Steak Florentine style!  

This place is here to stay.

This is my one of favorite restaurants in the city. I love their drinks and food. It's always busy during the weekday evenings so I'd recommend putting in a reservation through open table. I can mimic some of their dishes but not quite to perfection. Wish I could figure out how they do the fried coccole!

Reading the reviews and also the back sorry lends itself to a positive experience.  
The food was great and the drinks were equally excellent.  Service at the bar was sub standard.  It felt like I was doing them a favor by sitting at the bar.  I had to ask for menus, drinks, and food options.  No advice was given.  The tarbender seemed more concerned about her lipgloss then my dining experience.  Overall it was a good experience and could have been better.

While the food and service was good enough, I did enjoy the ambience a bit more. Rustic and warm. We ordered: Tuscan Kale Caesar, Carne pizza, "Pasta in a Jar", and the Seared Scallops. The carne pasta and seared scallops were excellent. The salad and pasta in a jar were just ok. Our server was nice enough. Overall, we had a good time.

I like it. A lot. It's in no way a 5 star place, but you can't be when you try to be a fine dining establishment, and the see and be seen nightlife spot. Never works.

This place is PACKED. always. Whether its locals grabbing a bite, singles pretending to nonchalantly be grabbing a cocktail on a Tuesday, in full Saturday gear, or out of place tourists, psyched to catch a glimpse of Fabio. ( Tourists drive me nuts). So book ahead if you want to sit down.

My biggest issue with the place, the bartenders have been consistent rude. I bartended for 12 yrs, it sucks. But it's your JOB, and you're in the service industry. If your bf broke up with you, you got hammered last night, a customer is being a douche, oh well. Fake it! And paying the premium cost for a cocktail makes it that much more imperative. Don't act bored with me, I'm on your side. I'm easy to serve, and I tip well. Service in Chicago is beyond embarrassing.

However, it's a gorgeous spot, the food is very good, and it has an impressive bar scene. If I wanted to run into anyone semi famous in Chicago, it'd definitely be Fabio...but I'm not running there for that alone.

We were going to the steakhouse nearby when we walked past Sienna Tavern and noticed a large crowd of people sitting at the outside tables so decided to give it a try. We are so glad we changed our minds because we had great food & service. The pasta is amazing!!!

Really a delicious meal.  The octopus appetizer was fabulous.  Also got a mushroom truffle pasta dish - the pasta was perfect, clearly not store bought!  And had a beet salad with sweet, delicious yellow beets. Although the place was packed, we were not rushed out.  Service was great too, both the server and the rest of the waitstaff (my water was filled regularly, plates cleared away efficiently).  Only slightly negative was the time it took to get reservations, and also the noise inside the restaurant - it was loud! Between the large group of people at a table near us and the music, I felt like I was shouting.  Not the greatest for an intimate dinner, but the food was so fabulous I'd still recommend.

This restaurant is absolutely wonderful! I was in Chicago for work, and my friend suggested that we try Siena for dinner. We tried so many great things: their homemade mozzarella, pasta in a jar, gnocchi, and the Goose Island beer made specially for their restaurant. The pastas are definitely very heavy but delicious. It is also a little more on the expensive side, but I think with the quality of the food that the price is warranted. I will definitely try this place again when I return. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Wow, wow, wow!
Early was great for me and my family having dinner. My wife ordered off the menu and I ordered pizza. Wish we could do that at Osterio Via Stato next to our house but nope. You have to eat pizza in the bar or dinner menu in the restaurant but not at Siena!. Such a great atmosphere and the staff are well trained. Ill be back Friday.

This place is overrated. It's more of place to see and be seen then actually dine on quality Italian food. I've dined all over the world and rely on community boards to assist finding gems. It doesn't have to be expensive to be good and vice versa. Back to why it failed tremendously. The food was bland, every dish we ordered had a very bland taste to it. Even the gnocchi truffle cream pasta, with shaved truffle on top which we paid and additional $25 for. The so called amazing 12 hour braised osobuco, again bland in flavor, and not falling off the bone. Also had a strong porkish flavor. Do not order the flourless chocolate cake, ugh, and their self proclaimed famous Gelato's are terrible. We thought something sweet might gain a point in redemption from our $335.00 bill. Granted we had a bottle of Silver Oak pp $150.00. After that it was 2 apps, 2 pasta's and the Osobuco. Waste of time and money. Truly disappointed I wasted a good opportunity to eat fine food in Chicago at this place. Many hotels will recommend this restaurant and same with Yelp. Don't be fooled.

Make reservations! Do not walk in expecting to get a table in a hour. Opened by Top Chef-winner Fabio!

Drink - Between my friends and I we tried almost every cocktail on the menu and they were all, very, very good and I am a girl who usually sticks to various beers or a vodka based drink because I do not care for the taste of other liquors. My favorite was #1. My friend's favorite was #2 and our guy friend's fav was #9.

Eat - From the Pizza Bar (see menu) I tried the Truffle Mushroom pizza: everything about it was perfect. Outstanding

From the Mozzarella Bar I tried Bellweather Farm Ricotta Cheese, by the way you are not just getting cheese. This would make appetizer. Excellent

I will return for the pasta when I do not plan on a night out in the city! I can hardly wait.

Oh ya, make sure you dress your best;)

Stopped here while on business in Chicago me and my co workers stopped here around midnight...we were all hungry and was one of the only places still open serving food. I ordered the margarita pizza with mozzarella and tomatoes ..it was very good the crust was well done just how I like it. Very upscale crowd...only thing we didn't like was the loud music that made it impossible to speak at our table

I went here for the 1st time last year soon after they opened and wasn't crazy about it. I think we ordered the wrong things and didn't go on the best night. I have been back twice since and loved everything!

I tried the burrata appetizer, Brussels sprout salad, truffle pizza, gnocchi and some other things, and everything was wonderful!
We had one of the homemade pasta dishes, shrimp gazpacho and grilled shishito peppers and everything was very good! House specialty drinks are well made but pretty small for $14-$16 a pop.

Fantastic experience with family/child accommodating.    I've had wonderful meals previously at Siena on business and decided to bring the family together for our holiday "splurge" meal.   Even though they are obviously going for a more adult crowd, I did notice a few family gatherings in place, and our server did not hesitate at all (or give any dirty looks) while tuning a few of the meals to work with the kiddos.

EVERY one of the dishes we had was a big hit, from the octopus appetizer (I get it every time, and it is the best I've had, charred perfectly and tender), to the papperdelle (a bit boring compared to the other options, except where it counts, in taste).   Finishing it off with the caramel cookies (and sharing some bombolini deserts, incredible).    

Literally every person at the table was loving their respective dishes, fantastic job.   Hope they keep the quality bar high, I plan on making it a regular stop anytime I am back in Chicago

The MONKEYBREAD dessert is seriously 1 of the best things I have ever tasted in. my. life.  

Perfect ratio of (brioche?) bread to caramel sauce to candied hazelnuts.

It was heavenly.

Save room for it!

There isn't anything on the vegetarian friendly side of the menu that I've had here that I haven't liked. The flavors are really rich (read: super delicious but you wouldn't want to inquire about the calorie content) but not overpowering. Farro pasta is superb.

I've had dinner here around the time they opened and it was incredible. The meatball appetizer was legitimate, then the black ink linguine in lobster sauce was arguably the best pasta I've had in this city. I never order desert but the waitress convinced me to try the little donuts....let me just say it was WELL worth saving room for on future visits.

This morning I had the brunch and the steak and eggs were just like everything else I've had here...incredible. Good price and a very good sized portion. You can't go wrong with this place.

I think this place is just ok especially for the price.  Not good Not Bad.  There were some dishes that were good some that were just ordinary but none that were awful.  They pride themselves with FROM SCRATCH preparation of dishes and you can taste that difference.  They have a real good menu with a good quality selection.  

Kale Ceasar - i wanted a healthy so I got this.  I
Prosciutto Pear pizza was heavenly
Seared scallop risotto had 3 scallops in it over risotto, it was good but not worth 30 bucks
Ossobucco was good
Squid Ink Linquini with lobster was good
My favorite was Bellwether Farm Ricotta Cheese - this was yummy
Tiramisu was excellent

Ambience is nice and cosy.  Im glad I tried this place and I would still recommend it but i dont see myself coming back for a repeat

Siena Tavern is incredible. I went last night with my husband and had one of the best dining experiences in Chicago in recent memory. We've been going to Siena Tavern since it opened, but last night was so memorable, I had to write a rave review!

We walked in and were greeted by a nice hostess. We didn't have a reservation, so since all the tables in the main dining room were reserved, we decided to sit at the back pizza bar. What a great decision! We had THE BEST bartender/server. His name was Tariq and he was attentive, knowledgeable, and a genuinely great guy. He provided some recommendations, but we went with our tried and true favorites: the coccoli, grilled octopus, and burnt pepperoni pizza. The food came out quickly and was absolutely delicious (as always!!). We also ordered a great bottle of wine. After we finished eating, we drank our wine and debated dessert.  We were stuffed, but of course ordered some gelato, which is made in-house and is so delicious!! I recommend the tiramisu flavor and also ask for the birthday cake gelato if it's not on the menu--it's easily one of the greatest things I've ever eaten. Anyway, after we stuffed ourselves, we hung around a bit longer and enjoyed the rest of our wine. We sat and chatted for quite a while, but Tariq never rushed us and made us feel extremely welcome and comfortable. Even though he was super busy behind the bar, he never made us wait and treated us as if we were his priority. Best server ever!

Sure, Siena is a bit pricey (typical River North), but when it's consistently delicious and when the service is excellent, we really don't mind paying for an exceptional overall experience. I can't wait to go back and sit in Tariq's section again!  Cheers!

Excellent, extraordinary, warm and welcoming. From the food to the staff, the the atmosphere and the man who made a pass on my girlfriend. This tavern is a prime choice to venture into and experience Chicago. This is a place you would want to dress casual.... However, I did not. I entered the tavern in a hoodie, gym shoes and windbreaker pants. The only thing I had going for me was my beautiful and very attractive girlfriend.
Gentlemen, I dare say you ought to take your lovely lady to a place like this.. AND dress appropriate so that you don't feel out of place.

3rd time here over the last few months, and can confirm that it is still an amazing dining experience. I highly recommend trying this place if you are in the vicinity.. Coccoli app is out of this world good! Hopefully they keep it going for a long time!

My first experience at Siena Tavern was at an opening luncheon for the commercial tenants of my building, since Siena is attached. I was able to sample almost everything on the menu and I have to say, every SINGLE thing I had was incredible. Some of their food incorporates very interesting combinations of flavors that can sound a but off-putting, but everything ends up being amazing.

Now having been back a few times for dinner, I can't speak highly enough of their truffle pizza (really all their pizzas). Additionally, I love their innovative drink menu. The drinks are definitely pricey, but I think they are worth it.

I like the atmosphere at Siena because it's in a relatively large space, but still feels incredibly cozy and intimate. This is a great date-night place, but also good for after work cocktails or a girls' night out.

Worst salad ever. I rarely do reviews, but I could not let this go unnoticed. Ordered the Siena chopped salad and, by no stretch of the imagination, cardboard dipped in mayonnaise would have tasted better. It listed all these yummy ingredients - avocado, tomato, canellini beans, artichokes - fake, chewy, gross. All atop grade D shredded lettuce you find at Taco Bell. ONLY giving this a second star based on location and atmosphere.
Nice outdoor eating area. Impeccable service. I had beef tartare as an app and gnocchi for main course, both of which I would highly recommend.

LOVED IT!

Everything we ordered here was fantastic from the drinks to the dessert. I went there with my mother and aunt and we shared everything and tried to get a little bit from each part of the menu. We, of course, started with the meatball which was very tasty. Not the best meatball I've ever had but it was good and the sauce was delicious and so fresh tasting. Another noteable item was the bellwether farm ricotta with crispy mortadella.... OH MY. I mean who ever thought of frying mortadella cubes was an effing genius. It was SO good. Came with grilled bread and pesto as well and it was gone nearly as soon as it was down on the table. We had a pizza with eggplant on it that was just ok - but I think it was poor ordering on our part. It wasn't memorable.

But the absolute STAR of the meal was the SHORT RIB RAVIOLI - WOW. I'm pretty sure we licked the plate clean. I could have eaten a bucket of those things. Best pasta I've ever had in my life.

This was a great dining experience. Went for lunch on a weekday and though no tables were available, the host seated us in the lounge area at two sofas and a large coffee table. Skeptical at first, this ended up being a tremendous amount of fun. Comfortable, relaxed, but bustling scene. The space is great. Interesting layout, and it feels very roomy...could be the bountiful use of mirrors throughout. Food was very good, burger was loaded with flavor and dessert, though not needed, was quite necessary. Bonus star for the bathroom sink fixtures...the faucet is like a shower for your hands. A nice touch...neat place.

This place is going to be our go to place for years to come.  From the moment you walk in you feel at home.  The hostesses were friendly, the decor was thoughtful and the ambiance felt part Chicago, part Italy.

The menu is so diverse that I think we need to go back about 5 more times to try everything.  Rarely do you find a menu where not one thing looks bad!  Everything we had was awesome, especially unique was the Coccoli, a crispy dough (like a puff pastry) that you stuff with cheese, prosciutto and truffle honey. OMG, ridiculous.  Next we had the highly recommended Kobe Meatball, again another win!  Other favorites for dinner were the Prosciutto Pear Pizza, the Baked Lasagna (the owner's mom's recipe I believe?) and the absolute most decadent, fluffy, rich gnocchi you will try, truffle cream, with crispy pancetta.  Unreal actually.

We ended our night by trying the out of this world, Bomboloni.  They were like little donuts (made with some mashed potatoes to add fluff) that you could infuse with carmel, chocolate or raspberry yourself at the table with little squirt bottles.  A must try!

This place seems to have knowledgeable staff, great atmosphere, awesome wine and creative whiskey drinks.  Siena Tavern pushes the bar up even higher in Chicago, its just right!

This restaurant is wonderful. I would definitely recommend it for lunch, dinner, special occasion. Their appetizers are delicious, the coccoli and the burata and different cheeses are all really good. You can't go wrong with any of their entrees, all of the pizzas, pasta dishes, and entrees we have had were really good. Drinks and dessert are great as well. Brunch menu is nothing special, I'd stick to all of the items on their regular menu!

I had really been looking forward to a trip to Siena Tavern, and they definitely met my expectations. I'd definitely recommend it!

We ordered drinks (interesting Sangria and Goose Island's Siena Tavern-exclusive brew). For the entrees, we had the Short Rib Ravioli and the Carne Pizza. They were both really good, although the Ravioli was the highlight - think Braised Beef-filled Ravioli with a creamy, flavorful sauce. The way that it was served made it great American food with a really good Italian twist.

We were there for a birthday, and Gregory, our server was really good, he later brought us a complimentary scoop of Birthday Cake Gelato (tastes JUST like cake!) to celebrate.

I would have easily given this place a 4 or 5 star rating because of the appetizers alone, but I can't justify it because of my entree.  
Went there with my girls for a bach party dinner and we were all starving.  Quickly ordered the mushroom pizza and burnt pepperoni pizza along with couple order of the meatball (singular) for appetizers.  I don't know if it was because we were so hangry, but the mushroom pizza was heavenly.  Soooo delicious, not too rich, crust was nice and thin.  Burnt pepperoni had the little spicy kick to it which was a nice contrast to the creamy mushroom one.  The meatball is huge, definitely enough for even 4 people to share.  Great flavor and the sauce was so good I kept dipping my crust in it.  

I think they thought we were done after the pizzas and the meatballs because it took them a long time to come back and see if we were going to order entrees.  Little do they know how much we eat.... Anyway, we each ordered a separate entree so we could all share.  I tried a little bit of the gnocchi which was so fluffy and perfect, and the squid ink pasta was my personal favorite.  I would get that again if I ever return.  It was so good I took a little bit off the plates of three friends who ordered it so I would eat all of someone's.  The risotto was also notable.  It was HUGE too.  The entree that was a complete fail though was mine - the Seared Scallop (not singular...comes with 4).  It was so incredibly salty that I honestly could not even eat one whole scallop.  I tried.  I really did.  Even tried scraping off the top green sauce and it was still hurting my tongue with the salt content.  The greens and puree underneath was salty too which just ruined my taste buds.  I would have sent it back to the kitchen, expect I ate so much of my friend's plates that I wouldn't have been able to eat another entree anyway.  

So - is it fair for me to give it 3 stars just because of the scallops?  Yes - it is a main entree and a waste of money and appetite.  No - to be completely fair I should allow another visit to try the dish again but I just can't make my mouth suffer again like that.  

Do get the pizza, meatball, squid ink pasta, and ask for Arturo to take your group pic.
Don't get the scallops or go late Sunday night b/c they tend to run out of items and service gets slow.

What is the hype?  The drinks are pre-mixed and totally average, on a Friday don't even think about sitting at the bar (at 5:00pm).
We had the margarita pizza (meh) but the Shisito peppers were great, as well as the donuts and the burrata.

I enjoyed an extremely solid lunch here on a random weekday afternoon. Sienna Tavern definitely fits into River North, there's tons of well decorated space and the menu was excellent. Our table feasted on the pear and prosciutto pizza, brussel sprout salad, a burger and the daily soup & roasted cauliflower. The pizza was as delicious as any specialty pizza gets, and the size of the pizza was very satisfactory for the price. The brussel sprout salad was actually pretty underwhelming, but the rest of what we consumed that day was pretty delicious. Another star for the adorable logo and packaging for takeout orders.

Our server was attentive and enthusiastic, and all in all we had a great meal. No reservations necessary for lunch, but I think that for dinner you're looking at two weeks out.

We love this place!  We go here often for lunch and the food is amazing!  the Grilled Octopus, Brussels, Cauliflower and Kale Caesar are my favorites.  Not to mention the Truffle Pizza....truffle oil, not real truffles, but still delicious to me.   It is my go to place in the neighborhood!  However, I tried walking in for dinner at 9pm and OMG, the crowd was not to be believed. It felt like all the bars in that area. Not sure what I expected. I will never go there for dinner.  I suggest stick to lunch.  : )

Completely solid restaurant, I have been here a few times so I can say this.  Everything that I have ordered here has been really fantastic.  I have had the Coccoli, their burger, the lobster roll, and the mussels and clams.  The one thing I can complain about is some of the prices.  For instance, the lobster roll is $28.00, and I wouldn't think the price is that bad if I didn't have anything to compare it to.  The best lobster roll I have ever had included a lb of lobster served warm for $25.00.  There is no way there is even close to a lb of lobster. It's pretty tiny.  Ok, I'm done bitching.   Seriously a solid lunch option for Chicago.  Service has always been great too.

Where to start.. this place was FABULOUS!
Everything I had was amazing (except the pizza, it wasn't special, I would skip it next time). We were lucky enough to swipe a table next to the bar and had a back up reservation somewhere else in case we couldn't eat here, but it was my birthday so I had my heart set on it. As soon as we were seated, our service was outstanding.
The gnocchi was probably my favorite, but we probably tried 5-6 different things instead of getting an entree.
The drinks were pretty good as well, not the best, but I was satisfied.
What made it all worth it was the birthday cake gelato at the end of the night, and OMG it was soo good.
I will DEFINITELY be back here, one of the best restaurants I've been to in Chicago.

AMAZING. I tried all the appetizers (no, really. I did) and a few of the meats and cheese. Everything was presented wonderfully and tasted delicious. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

Our server was Adam and he was so accommodating and attentive. Next I go back I'm going to request him as my server.

Since it's still kind of new in River North I would definitely make a reservation a few weeks in advance. The place was packed around 9 pm on a Friday - not a single table or seat was open.

Totally giving 5 Stars for fabulous food selections from our server (and I stupidly do not remember her name... I'll just have to go again;)

We asked her to choose and this is what we thoroughly enjoyed......

Grilled Octopus (so amazing... I want some as I write this at almost 2am)
Ahi Tuna-crudo (yummy salsa verde & crushed peppercorns)
Bufala Mozzarella (love the tomato jam)
Prosciutto Pear-pizza (tons of fresh arugula on top)
Scallops-crudo... as in raw and so damn tasty (I do not see this on the menu but they had a spicy flavor along the outside of them)

Lastly... she ordered us dessert.  It was a Tart.... which was way too heavy, thick and tart like :(  So... don't get the tart... try something light and sexy.  The name Tart is very deceiving here .. haha.

Overall great experience and I can not wait to go back!!!!

Chicago, Illinois
 Pretty good food, very slow service.  We were a group of about 11 sitting in the back room.  We shared most of the apps and several of the entrees with nearly all being very good.  For dessert we had the doughnuts and tiramisu, these two dishes were great.

Unfortunately however the service was very slow.  This place has the typical, Cool, Chicago, Trendy vibe.  It was a great scene (10 June 2013).  Unfortunately however our server would disappear for 7 or 8 minutes at a time, completely unacceptable.  Give us an additional server and I guarantee the additional bar tab offsets the labor.  Leaving the table to go to the bar to order drinks is not good.

Also, a few of us sat outside, on the sidewalk, for about an hour prior to dinner; my first drink took about 20 minutes the second arrived just before we went to our table.  Both were very good, #5 and a #8?, just too slow.  So... the service outside the dining room was slow as well.  Mr/Ms GM, beef up the staff!  Back to the food, we had the Parm Fries with our drinks....very good.

I believe they're a new restaurant...so hopefully they'll work out the staffing kinks.

Great food, great atmosphere, great night.

This is definitely a place to splurge, everything was very rich, but delicious. For me the standouts were the Coccoli (crispy dough, stracchino cheese, prosciutto di parma, truffle honey), grilled octopus (tender and flavorful) and the homemade gnocchi with truffle cream, fried sage and crispy pancetta which was to die for.

Reservations are hard to come by, definitely plan in advance.

We went here for my husband's birthday and I am so glad we did.  We had 5:30 reservations, but when we got there were able to snag a table in the bar area because the Blackhawks (whoohoo) were on.

This place was packed by 6:!5 and our server was great.  

We came hungry and ordered the following:

Grilled Octopus - Yummy, but I still love Girl and the Goats better.
Kobe Meatball - So good, the flavors were spot on and the meatball was cooked perfectly.
Foccacia - We got this as a filler and I think I would pick something else to try when going back.
Gnocchi - My favorite thing, it just melted in your mouth.
Bomboloni - My husband loved this, I think it might be due to squeezing the flavors into the dessert.  

With a bottle of wine and espresso for the two of our bill was only $120 and we were stuffed.  Compared to RPM, I would pick Siena Tvern every time.

Do not miss brunch at Siena Tavern!  The Bloody Mary was delicious, well spiced and garnished with citrus, celery, a small piece or mortadella and cheese.  Sampled the truffled eggs-ri-dic-ulous!  The sausage gravy and biscuits looked amazing.  The potatoes that arrive with some dishes are crispy perfection.  I'll be back!
Food is phenomenal! I enjoy the outside seating in the summer . Brick oven pizza is the best..... Oh and all desserts I've tried there  are delicious.
Brick Chicken- one of the Best chicken dishes I ever had, served with amazing parmesan potatoes and arugula salad..

Chef Fabio's 4 week old new spot in Chicago!  Definitely was high on my bookmark list to try!

Sort of unfair to Siena is that I walked in with very high expectations.  The decor of this place was awesome.  Very Restoration Hardware and high-end lounge feel to the place.  

We started with grilled octopus, bone marrow and mussels.  Our server was great in putting in the order in waves so it was one dish at a time versus it all just being dumped on us.  The mussels were very good!  It was served in this amazingly good tomato broth that had these tasty chunks of tomato in them!  In fact one person in the group was more focused on eating the tomatoes than the mussels!  The gilled octopus was the best I have ever had!  It was meaty, tender and clearly seasoned to perfection.  Eat bite had great taste and smoky flavor!  Loved how there was a slight hint of spiciness with the peppers, celery and octopus.  The bone marrow was full flavored, rich fatty goodness offset by the acid from the balsamic marinated mushrooms.

We ordered as a table pizza, pesto pasta and gnocchi.  The gnocchi was creamy, soft and pure comfort food.  The pesto pasta was the best entree ordered!  That pesto sauce was to die for.  The pizza was good but the pesto clearly was the meal of the night.

The cocktails were extremely well made and tasted very good.  Only downer of the night was that Chef Fabio wasn't there.  It's a must try spot!

Situation: Party of 5 showed up around 6:30 on a Monday but there were no tables in the dining room and no cancellations so we sat in the bar for about an hour and a high top table opened and we snagged it.  Note, a lot of people are waiting in the bar so it is best to just ask the table very very politely when their bill comes if you can snag it.

Drinks:  Beer is very, very reasonably priced here, $5 my hubby had quite a few Revolution anti-heroes and the $12 cocktail price is standard.  Where I was most impressed was the wine list!  Going out downtown and finding bottles of wine in the $30-40 can be difficult and annoying, but they have a great variety.  Memorable drinks were the No. 11 and No.1.

Food: Solid, so awesome! Coccoli was fantastic,  Kobe meatball was tender and moist, and the grilled octopus was very tasty and perfectly cooked.  Brussel Sprout salad was very light, and I think they must blanch them because as another review said, you really don't get that heavy brussel taste. Farro Pasta was great and the pesto was really to die for.  Carbonara was outstanding and the bacon was really amazing. Double chop was also awesome, although one of their pricier options, it was well worth the splurge.  The Truffle mushroom Pizza was a surprise favorite, seriously crust was perfect cheese was divine and the truffle was pretty heavy, in the best way possible.

Service: Waitress, I believe Tiffany, was very nice, gave great recommendations and helped us with the wine menu and making sure we had a reasonable $32 bottle to enjoy.  Only hiccup of the night, and really only being open for a month and a half I'm assuming will get worked out, is that all entrees came out except for the veal chop which took another 5-8 minutes.  No biggie, they did apologize for it and ask for patience with the kinks.  

Bottom line: Will be back, will recommend to friends.  Also, very heavy Italian food, I would suggest splitting a salad or app and a main and splurging on an extra drink or two.  Really, you will be stuffed.

I had high expectations of this place.  The food was good, but not great. The strange thing was the first time I visited (when they first opened), the tavern burger was good, but the 2nd time I ordered it was a let down.  The bun used to have rosemary, the cheese and tomato jam was plentiful, and the burger was pretty juicy.  What happened?

My group of 4 ordered the bone marrow- big disappointment.  The whole dish was slathered in way too much balsamic vinegar, only one bone had any marrow in it, and they only gave us 3 tiny pieces of bread with it (for 4 people).

The pappardelle pasta was really boring.  Your normal sauce and pasta... nothing else.   Ragu?  I have and can make a better sauce with bread or SOMETHING else to go with it- no problem.

The lobster club was fresh w/ tons of lobster.  But again- not anything to talk about. Yawn.

The hype of this place and the EXTREME prices don't fit the food. Service, however, was superb.

The first time we came here for dessert and coffee and sat at the bar. The place was packed and the crowd was mainly young professionals. Very classy place without being outrageously expensive. The bartender serving us was cool and took good care of us. Really liked the atmosphere and the bar had a cool decor.

Came here again for dinner. I had been craving home made pasta for a while so I immediately picked the pappardelle. Soooo good! The pasta is like flat wide sheets with meat sauce. So simple yet so tasty. My husband was jealous he didn't also order it. Saw the cooks preparing a pizza that looked really good. If I'm in the area again I'll have to try it.

We had these little donuts for dessert that came with little bottles of vanilla, caramel, and chocolate syrup that you inject into the donuts. The donuts were totally yummy and fun.

Both times we sat at the bar and the bartenders were totally cool and very attentive. Being from L.A. a place like this can be pretentious but I didn't get that from Siena Tavern. Wasn't snooty and we had a really good experience.
This place is good! Pizza is tasty and the service wonderful! Honestly my favorite part was the birthday cake gelato! Come for your birthday and be sure you tell the waitress so you get a scoop!

It is a bit pricy, but the Tuffle Mushroom pizza and coccoli are amazing! Food definitely tastes fresh and the bar area is huge which is great for lunch and/or a place to start before heading out on a Friday/Saturday night.

This is a review of the bar and drinks only.
Siena Tavern is one of River North's newest hot spots.  I stopped in late on a Tuesday night for a drink.  The space is beautiful and large with big windows looking out onto the street.  The room feels comfortable and laid back.  Lots of space.
The bartenders were both fine.  The young, brunette female bartender was especially friendly, and refilled our waters numerous times, even though we just had one drink and cashed out.  I appreciated that.  Nothing worse than being ignored after the tip is received.  She also poured me a taste of the wine I selected before committing.
The wine list left something to be desired.  Only one BTG option per varietal is slightly annoying.  I would prefer more options.
I'll probably be back sometime soon to try the food.

i now get the hype...

when this place first opened up and i grew more frustrated that i couldn't even get a lunch reservation, i'd say to myself "how could an overpriced pasta place be doing so well".  well yes, location is everything and it made for the perfect location for a pre-theatre meal but they also do more than fancy pizza and pasta. we were grateful that they let us keep our car in valet so that we could just walk to the chicago theatre after din.
no surprise, we could not get a reservation but arriving at 6:30 on a saturday, 2 spots at the bar opened up fairly quickly (even for a busy evening of hawks' opener and chicago marathon madness). i'm actually glad we sat at the bar with our "server" at our disposal for questions and chatting. our bartender was more knowledgeable about the food (and drinks) than some servers i've had. the best part of our shared appetizer dinner - the farro salad (vegetarians - get it without the seafood). wow - just wow! the dressing, the hearty farro and the crisp greens and green beans were perfection. the burrata is served with a smoky-sweet tomato jam.  the mushroom truffle pizza - exceptional. i normally can easily pitch the crust especially for italian style pizzas but not siena's.
i knocked off one star because i struggled to find a wine by the glass that i really enjoyed which i find shocking for this type of establishment. i settled for an "okay" chianti that i've seen on the shelves of tj's for 1/10th the price.
Service was impeccable. Food was even better! I had the lobster squid ink. My boyfriend had the ravioli. And the meatballs were awesome! Definitely coming back next time we are in Chicago.

The ambiance here is amazing but let me tell you, the food is even better!

If you're looking for a trendy place to dine, Siena Tavern is perfection.  Swung over here for lunch with several co-workers and was completely impressed with this swanky eatery.  The staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating.  Our server had loads of recommendations, which was very helpful and made for a great lunch.

First off: The focaccia bread. Even after all the food we ordered, the focaccia was the star of the show.  It was dense, moist, and decadent. Forget about the carbs and eat it all.

We moved onto the grilled octopus, which is served with duck fat potatoes, red chilies, celery, aged balsamic, and chive.  It was tender, juicy, and left me aching for another order. We also shared an order of burrata, which comes with grilled bread, tomato jam, sea, salt and olive oil.

FInally, I had the shaved brussel sprouts salad, which comes with parmigiano and toasted marcona almonds.  It was good if you're looking for a light lunch but after eyeing my co-worker's farro salad, it left me drooling over hers instead!

I'll definitely be going back, especially for the pizza bar!

Great food for lunch, convenient location, they have valet parking even for lunch and they have outdoor seating facing both Dearborn and Kinzie to do people watching at lunch. They have a good full stocked bar and the menu style is tapas but obviously more Italian geared. I recommend the sashimi(esq) dishes and the meatball appetizer as well as the gnocchi. The salads are also good. Definitely a top tiered choice compared to other places in the area.  Also, they have a "board room" type private dining area for groups of 10-16 that's good for business meetings. The wait staff are VERY attractive as well as clientele in the bar area.

I've only heard good things about Siena Tavern and I FINALLY went for the first time last night to celebrate a birthday.

We started off with Moscow Mules which we excellent. I also ordered Sangria later in our meal - excellent as well. For an app we ordered the Mozzarella Burrata - delicious, I particularly liked the hint of cinnamon it had. For our meal we ordered the Ahi Tuna, Gnocchi and Mushroom Truffle Pizza. PHENOMENAL - all of it. My favorite item though, was the Gnocchi; the gnocchi itself was light and fluffy and the truffle sauce was rich.

Overall had an amazing experience at Siena Tavern. From the food, to the drinks, to the service, to the atmosphere - it was phenomenal!

Holy mackerel, this place is a ball of crazy.

The fiance and I stopped in here after dinner the other night to check it out, have a drink or two.  First off, we were there at a slightly awkward time, around 9:30, so the dinner crowd was lingering, but the clubby types had arrived en masse.  (Let me say, for the record, I was not expected clubby types at this place, but boy did they represent).

Plusses: I had a glass of prosecco that was decent and was served in a champagne saucer which was utterly charming.  Also, though I can hardly imagine how it could have been more crowded, there seemed to be enough standing room to not feel completely claustrophobic.

Minuses: wowzers, douche-bag city.  If that's your scene, no judgement, that might be a plus for you, but not so much for me.  At one point a certain gentleman fitting the above description jostled my arm and caused me to spill the better portion of aforementioned prosecco down my silk blouse.  And he didn't even notice.  Also, at least at the back bar, there were only two beers on tap, which disappointed my gentleman companion.

I can't speak to the food, I only witnessed the (somewhat schizophrenic) decor, atmosphere, and a single glass of bubbly.
Waygu  beef Meat Ball & coccoli appetizers were awesome!   No entree necessary!   Waiting for our dessert which sounds divine--Bomboloni & monkey bread!
Kale caesar salad and pepperoni pizza were both amazing. Service was fast and great. Delicious old fashioned.
Everything was wonderful at this place. The service was great. The delivery of the meal was timely. The food was melt in your mouth delicious! Excellent food at a good price. Just go!

Great decor, nice staff, great menu!

To drink we ordered the sangria. It was made with white wine, but it didn't say in the menu... weird...

We had the gnocchi (LOVED them!) and the short rib ravioli (AMAZING!). For dessert the Warm Chocolate Butter Cake, very good!

Will return to try the rest of the menu!

This place was incredible! I never rave about food, however there was seven of us and everything was delicious. I highly recommend the meatball appetizer, the best "spaghetti" I've ever had in my life with spicy sauce & crab meat, and the Italian donuts that you inject with the creamiest carmel, chocolate, or raspberry. Bon appetite!! I will be back.

Bar tenders are rude and disinterested, waitstaff doesn't care, manager's priority is flirting with the girls and buying them free drinks. On top of that the food is average and overpriced. Go elsewhere.

Everything here was outstanding. From the decor, to the service, and most importantly the food. The decor was modern and eye-catching. Our server was nice and attentive. But the food was just out-of-this-world. We started with the Coccoli which is a crispy ball of dough with a light fluffy inside and it is served with stracchino cheese, proscuttio, and truffle honey. The combination of the sweet truffle honey, salty proscuttio, creamy cheese, and that crisptastic dough balls. My main course was Squid Ink Linguini with Grilled Lobster Tail and Spicy Lobster Sauce. The al dente pasta goes along beautifally with the heat and creaminess of the lobster sauce. For dessert we had the Monkeybread which just finished the meal off on a boss note.

Love the layout of this place, large and open, tables not too crowded together.  The acoustics are a little rough though, it felt like we had to yell across the table to have a conversation, maybe because it was a full house?  The food was delicious, we all split a chopped salad and a kale salad.  I had the gnocchi truffle (signature dish/delicious) and others tried the pear and prosciutto pizza and the brick chicken, lasagna - - all very good.  It was my friend's birthday and the restaurant provided a gratis tiramisu complete with candle.  Overall a good experience but the service definitely has some kinks to be worked out.  I'd come here in another month or so and maybe it would be 5 stars.

Also, they have a private room you can reserve without a fee for a larger table/group.

Love love love LOVE this place. Their service was impeccable.  I am lactose intolerant so I am always hesitant going to Italian restaurants where most pastas are in a cream based sauce. However, I found found a few things on the menu that I could eat and  the waitress made sure that there was no dairy in my dish. I would really recommend the risotto with shrimp. It had a lot of flavor and the portion size was perfect for one.
It has a great ambiance and I would recommend this as a date place. It is a little pricey but the quality of the food is on point. Also try the donut holes - they are awesome and I would most definitely be back at this restaurant.

Good food, but a typically classless river north experience. We were seated half an hour late for our reservation  and then rushed by the wait staff for the entire meal. Was never offered a cocktail, no attendance from waitress on any desires. We saw the waitress three times and only promptly for the bill. Dishes were served out of order (side dishes served as appetizers).

The plates were insanely aggressively bussed with waiters and bussers leaning across the table to clean plates while other diners were only half finished with their meals.

The food was fine. Halibut was perfectly cooked if lacking in vegetable accompaniment. Kale Ceasar was almost too fresh, quite nice.

You can spend the same kind of money for food as good or better and service and ambiance that's designed for those older than postpubescents at a lot of other places nearby.

I really liked this place. I had the chopped salad and they were really accommodating to my allergies/preferences by making it egg and meat free. all the salads looked so good. I can't wait to try more items.

If you only eat one thing here, it should be the squid ink pasta. Wow. I also had and liked the pizza, beet salad and smoked mozzarella (served with honey comb) but the squid ink pasta was the stand out among the dishes and vs pasta at other Italian places. The gelato selection is very impressive too (10 flavors to choose from). I had blueberry lemon curd and strawberry pie.

We came for lunch so didn't need to worry about a wait. The food was very tasty. The servers were very friendly and helpful with the menu. The decor is really spectacular and we enjoyed looking around. I ordered the gnocchi it was okay but I felt it needed more flavor. I decided to try the white truffle shavings - totally not worth the $45 it was tasteless, no jokes. We had the bombilinos for dessert. Don't miss out on those. So much fun eating them and it was absolutely delicious!

I found a list online of must try foods and this one said that "If fried dough is on the menu, it's really a no-brainer that you need to order it."  We found the Coccoli  ($14) on the menu as an appetizer, so we ordered it.  It is fried balls of a dough that is more like an egg popover than a pizza dough but it is delicious, served with stracchino cheese (a flavorful creamy cheese) wrapped in prosciutto with truffle honey drizzled on it.   Delicious!    Would never have tried it had we not read the review.  

We also ordered the entrée of Short Rib Ravioli ($18), made with roasted porcini mushrooms.  Fresh homemade pasta!!!    For Dessert we shared the Boboloni ($9), which were puffy donuts, with four little squeeze bottles filled with (my favorite) the caramel, chocolate, raspberry chianti jelly, and a seasonal pumpkin cream.   You could try a different flavor on every bite and each one was sensational.  

Their décor is upscale chic', great booths and comfortable leather chairs, exposed bulb lighting and mirrored walls.  The music is loud enough to mask the talking and laughing but not loud enough that you can't hear your wait-person or each other.   It is a very fun atmosphere!  We have walked by many times in the evening and they have a very busy bar scene but we never ventured in, but now that we have, we will definitely be back.   We were there during Sunday brunch, and they were busy but we were still able to get a table.   Reservations are recommended.    We definitely plan on ordering pizza the next time because every one that came out looked fantastic!

**  Could not wait and went back for Pizza yesterday.   Wonderful burnt pepperoni pizza when hot, but hands down the worst leftover pizza ever.     Be sure to finish it there when its tasty hot!  :-)
The pizza at this place is phenomenal - By far the best pizza in the city. You guys need to try the spicy pepperoni pizza!
Great dirty martini with Blue Cheese Olives. Loved the Truffle pizza. Very cool atmosphere but make sure you reserve a table or be prepared to wait.

Love this place! The food was phenomenal. I love the atmosphere and you couldn't ask for a better location. We ordered the squid ink linguini, gnocchi, truffle mushroom pizza, shaved brussel sprout salad, coccoli, grilled octopus and hamachi. Everything was excellent!

I could have done without the hamachi just because everything else was so rich...it didn't really light a candle to the other dishes. Our server was OK and we had some trouble ordering additional rounds of drinks and place settings, but overall we had a great experience. I will definitely be back!

Italian food is my favorite food to cook as well as eat and I think I may have just found my new favorite contemporary Italian restaurant. First off, our waitress was beyond amazing and provided quite possibly the best service I have ever had at a restaurant in River North. The atmosphere is cozy but still very open. The pizza was beyond amazing and overall the price is definitely reasonable for how impeccable the food is. I will definitely be back soon!

I've been here several times now including dinner a few times, lunch, and a brunch.  Consistently good food and service.  The restaurant is nicely done, very comfortable, cozy and hip and the vibe is great as this place is almost always busy.  Reservations are hard to come by for dinner so book early.  
Both the food and drink are the real stars here.  Cocktails are nicely executed and quite tasty.  From a food perspective - I have not had a bad dish here.  My suggestion is to order a lot of different foods and share because it is all fun and delicious.  A few standouts for me have been the Brick Chicken (one of the best chicken dishes in Chicago - hands down!) - also the Burnt Pepperoni Pizza and the Kale Cesar Salad.  The Burata from the Mozzarella Bar is also delicious.  While this is not an inexpensive dinner when it is all said and done - but I think it's well worth it as they don't skimp on the portions or the flavor.  I'll be back as everyone I've brought here has really enjoyed the entire experience.

I'm really disappointed by Siena Tavern. A year and a half ago I came here and felt the same sentiment. When I wrote a review that was unfavorable, I was contacted and offered a redo meal on the house which was fantastic. I came here again because my boyfriend wanted to try it and to my dismay the experience was exactly like my first experience here: bland and expensive. I don't mind an expensive meal as long as the food is worth it, but unfortunately this food is just sooo not worth it. In summation, I'm over this place. If your looking for an amazing italian restaurant in Chicago go to La Scarola, Quartino, or Briciola.

I had high expectations for this restaurant, being a big fan of Fabio on Top Chef and having Siena Tavern in Chicago, surrounded by a high level of culinary geniuses. The food was great, had the carne pizza, chopped salad, black ink linguini with lobster, scallops and octopus for a few of us.

The ambiance and service were a complete turnoff. I made reservations for 5 people at 9pm, I called at 6 to tell them we only needed a table for 4 and asked if they had anything earlier, but they said they were completely booked. Okay, no problem.
